snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio’s potential agreement with the United Federation of Teachers, which would include retroactive pay, would settle a nearly five-year labor dispute.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio and the United Federation of Teachers reportedly are close to announcing an agreement to settle a nearly five-year-old labor dispute; agreement would include retroactive pay equivalent to roughly 8 percent of teachers' salaries, annual raises of up to 2 percent and substantial savings for the city on health coverage.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio’s potential agreement with the United Federation of Teachers, which would include retroactive pay, would settle a nearly five-year labor dispute.

headline.main: New York Said to Be on Verge of 9-Year Deal With Teachers’ Union
headline.print_headline: City Said to Be Nearing a Deal With Teachers
